intro: Astragalus peterae, commonly known as the Peter's milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus peterae is often found in alpine and steppe habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
